basics.name: Christophe Carreau-Lacasse
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: Fullstack senior software engineer with a strong background in web development, and an interest in anything multimedia

work.name: Big Fish Games
highlights: Part of a small agile team in charge of creating a web-based publisher portal
Managed a CI/CD pipeline with Kubernetes deployment on GCP
Adapted an existing Java and C# microservices game backend to fit the goal of the publisher portal
Mentored junior developers and helped them develop their soft and hard skills
Part of an on-call rotation to ensure reliability of our deployed services

work.name: Behaviour Interactive
work.summary: Worked on the Dead by Daylight back-end team
highlights: Worked on a distributed Typescript Node.js back-end handling thousands of requests per second
Refactored the micro-transactions logic to improve analytics and reduce technical debt

work.name: Square Enix Montréal
work.summary: Worked on the central Live-Ops team to create tools for the multiple game teams of the studio.
highlights: Built an internal tools portal in Angular that was used to manage the different live operations related features of all of our games
Worked on a large microservices architecture in C# (.NET 6) and Java for the back-end
Implemented multiple features in a Unity SDK
Put in place a new Dev Guild community more oriented toward actions and problem resolution

work.name: Internships
work.summary: Throughout my education I've had multiple programming internships
highlights: Web developer intern for Skytech Communication, on the Omnivox platform
Fullstack developer intern at Desjardins, working on the Accès D platform
Android developer intern at PPLCONNECT, a small startup of 4-5 employees

projects.name: Movie Rater
projects.description: Ultimate movie rating platform, where you find out your favorite movie by matching movies you've seen against each other
projects.summary: Ultimate movie rating platform, where you find out your favorite movie by matching movies you've seen against each other
highlights: Pairwise comparison using an ELO-based rating system for movies
Integrated a third-party API to fetch movie data
Docker container setup for development and deployment

projects.name: Resistance Online
projects.description: Unofficial port of the board game 'Resistance' to be played as a local couch-multiplayer game, where each player plays on their phone and the board is displayed on a big screen. Similar to Jackbox games.
projects.summary: Unofficial port of the board game 'Resistance' to be played as a local couch-multiplayer game, where each player plays on their phone and the board is displayed on a big screen. Similar to Jackbox games.
highlights: Websocket based real-time game for up to 10 players
React front-end architecture
Node.js with Express back-end architecture
